channel.title: HELP! MAJOR! will REP++!
channel.description: I accedently ip'd some1 on my server. and i dont know how to up ip them. I am useing Project Dungeonfest Source.

dont you have a command in game like ::unipban (name) or just find your ipban file and delete it,

item.title: HELP! MAJOR! will REP++!
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Check data/text/modlogs for his IP, then search for his IP in your server’s folder.

Read full topic

item.title: HELP! MAJOR! will REP++!
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“totalystylin1, post:6, topic:415473”][code=] if(cmd[0].equals("ipban") && (player.coowner == 1 || player.owner == 1 || player.getUsername().equals("alex"))) { String ban = command.substring((command.indexOf(" ") + 1)); int id = World.getWorld().getIdFromName(ban); Player banned = World.getWorld().getPlayers().get(id); if(banned != null) { Server.getFirewall().ipBanPlayer(banned); XStreamPlayerLoader.punish.writeTo(player.getUsername() + " [" + player.getSession().getRemoteAddress() +"] has ipbanned " + banned.getUsername() + " ip:" + banned.getSession().getRemoteAddress(), "data/text/modlogs"); } }

that’s it[/quote]
Told you… from first glance… it said data/text/modlogs… you just didnt look?..

Read full topic

item.title: HELP! MAJOR! will REP++!
item.dc:creator: @totalystylin1 totalystylin1
item.description:
@totalystylin1 wrote:

[code=] if(cmd[0].equals("ipban") && (player.coowner == 1 || player.owner == 1 || player.getUsername().equals("alex"))) { String ban = command.substring((command.indexOf(" ") + 1)); int id = World.getWorld().getIdFromName(ban); Player banned = World.getWorld().getPlayers().get(id); if(banned != null) { Server.getFirewall().ipBanPlayer(banned); XStreamPlayerLoader.punish.writeTo(player.getUsername() + " [" + player.getSession().getRemoteAddress() +"] has ipbanned " + banned.getUsername() + " ip:" + banned.getSession().getRemoteAddress(), "data/text/modlogs"); } }

that’s it

Read full topic

item.title: HELP! MAJOR! will REP++!
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Try going to his char files, and maybe there is something called like Banned = 0/1?

Or just keep searching the data files.

Hoped it helped.

Read full topic

item.title: HELP! MAJOR! will REP++!

the only “ban” files show usernames. no ip’s

item.title: HELP! MAJOR! will REP++!
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

Usually things like those are managed from a text file, go to the command, or were ever it is… and look for a path, and most likely it will lead to a text file, just delete their IP from the file.

Read full topic
